reviews.review_text:
A visit to Big Foot in Goa is a must for anyone looking to experience the rich cultural heritage of the region. Nestled in the serene surroundings, this place offers a wonderful insight into old Goa, its customs, traditions, and the livelihood of the people. The site is well-maintained and beautifully laid out, with a mix of history and culture that brings the past to life.

What truly sets Big Foot apart is its authentic representation of Goan life. From the traditional folk art to the displays of everyday customs, itâ€™s a great spot to immerse yourself in the local way of life. The vibrant atmosphere and charming displays are a photographer's dream.

The site also features a few quaint shops offering unique handmade goods. You can pick up local products like delicious handmade chocolates, earthen lamps, and other souvenirs that make for perfect mementos of your visit.

Whether you're a history enthusiast, a culture lover, or someone just looking for a peaceful, enriching experience, Big Foot in Goa is definitely worth a visit.

You can see Goan lifestyles here! They are made a creative status and audio voice to explain about it. English, Hindi audios are available. Entry fee 150Rs per head. For photos and parking we should pay extra. 2 wheeler parking 20rs & for camera 20 rs. Its take more than 1hr to visit. Beautiful place.

Absolutely worth spending an hour here! The artist has done an extraordinary job of bringing traditional Goan culture to life through stunning paintings and sculptures. Every piece reflects intricate craftsmanship and creativity. The highlight of the visit is the impressive longest stone sculpture, which is truly a masterpiece and stands out as a testament to the artist's skill and vision. The blend of art, tradition, and storytelling makes this place a must-visit for anyone looking to immerse themselves in Goan heritage and artistry!
